newsitem.title: IRAN: Kuwait sends warning to OPEC quota violaters.
newsitem.headline: Kuwait sends warning to OPEC quota violaters.

text.p: Kuwaiti oil minister Isa al-Mazeedi on Thursday sent a warning to those Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) members violating their output quotas, saying they should stick by official allocations or risk a further deterioration in oil prices.
Kuwait is one of three Gulf countries, along with Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates, which has maintained spare capacity while most other OPEC members are ignoring quotas.
He said that in the past two or three years "prices have not risen enough to compensate for production restraint" by those countries adhering to quotas.
Kuwait continues to adhere to its 2 million barrel per day official OPEC quota, the minister said.

In the latest Reuter's survey of OPEC production Thursday, oil companies and analysts had OPEC producing at 27.05 million barrels per day in April compared with the 25.03 million bpd ceiling agreed upon last June.
Abdullah Salem al-Badri, OPEC's president and Libya's oil minister, earlier said that demand was not strong enough to support any increase in the 11-member cartel's output.
"We are overproducing, yes, but I have contacted everyone and I hope we will have cooperation," he told Reuters while attending the conference.
